intro: Eriocaulon ligulatum var. dimerum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flat sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It thrives in wet or moist environments, often found in marshy areas or along the edges of ponds. Its botanical structure and habitat make it an important component of aquatic and wetland ecosystems.
